content_text:
⚙️ New on CrossCurve: Proposals
We’ve added a new section where $EYWA holders will soon be able to submit requests for future DAO votes.
👉
  t.co/yeEOipVeuC
Get ready to influence key decisions! First one is already there 👇
Proposals allow token holders to have more influence on what happens in the DAO and, as a consequence, on their own income from our DAO’s products such as CrossCurve. Voting starts two days after a proposal is published — so if a proposal goes up on a Monday, the voting will begin on Wednesday
Already, there is a live proposal: DAO EMISSON PROPOSAL
#1
. Itt sets an adjusted emission distribution of 1,262,295 $EYWA for the next quarter while keeping total emissions unchanged.
Speaking of emissions…
Emissions will be split:
🔹 50% on direct liquidity incentives
🔹 50% sent to Votemarket StakeDAO rewards
This will help secure additional CRV rewards, boost liquidity, and strengthen the DAO’s strategic position.
  app.crosscurve.fi/proposal

author: Unknown
content_text:
Curve founder Michael Egorov sells $CRV at a loss
Curve Finance (CRV) founder Michael Egorov sold 468,769 CRV for 238,171 USDC at $0.508, nearly nine hours ago, according to Spot On Chain on X. In December, he purchased 1.226 million CRV at an average price of $1.114 for $1.37 million. The investment is now at a $745,000 loss, down 54.6%.

If you've been in the
#crypto
market long enough, you'll notice similar incidents where attackers exploit a platform's weaknesses and transparency.
Examples :
- A user attacked Mango Markets by opening a long position on an obscure token, pumping its price 1,000x, then depositing the token as collateral to borrow stablecoins.
- Avi shorted $CRV, forcing the
#Curve
founder into liquidation
- Attacking AAVE, leaving around $2.5 million in bad debt for the lending platform.
